required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Population Burden of STI and Implication for Intervention in Hong Kong
clinical_study.official_title: Population Burden of Sexually Transmitted Infections and Implication for Intervention in Hong Kong

brief_summary.textblock: This is a 5-year cross-disciplinary sexually transmitted infection (STI) project involving a) territory-wide and community-based studies (survey and specimen collection); b) simulation of STI transmission dynamics and comparison of STI intervention strategies through mathematical modelling and cost-effectiveness analysis. The aim of this project is to assess the burden and the transmission dynamics of STIs in the general population and men who have sex with men (MSM) in Hong Kong. Around 1300 sexually experienced adults and 900 MSM would be recruited, 100 participants would be invited for individual in-depth interviews. Main outcome measures include STI history and service preference, effectiveness as measured by the proportion of new STI infections (chlamydia, gonorrhoea and human papillomavirus infections) averted above base-case scenario, and incremental cost-effectiveness ratio.

detailed_description.textblock: After completion of baseline questionnaire, the participants are invitied for STI self-sampling. If agree, a package of self-sampling kits, instructions, and packaging materials for return post would be delivered to their selected collection points. The second round of self-sampling would be offered at least one year from the first round of self-sampled specimens collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: willingness to pay for STI testing reported in questionnaire
prevalence of STI estimated through laboratory testing
secondary_outcome.description: prevalence of chlamydia trachomatis, Neisseria gonorrhoeae and human papillomavirus infections from self-collected samples

arm_group.description: sexually experienced adults (aged 18 or above) of the randomly selected household

arm_group.arm_group_label: men who have sex with men
arm_group.description: men who have sex with men aged 18 or above and normally living in Hong Kong

intervention.intervention_name: self-sampling kits for STI testing in laboratory
intervention.description: participants in both groups will receive self-sampling kits and deliver the collected samples to laboratory for testing
intervention.arm_group_label: men who have sex with men

biospec_descr.textblock: urine, penile swab, cervical swab, rectal swab, pharyngeal swab

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- aged 18 or above
- ever having sex
- normally living in Hong Kong
- can communicate in English or Chinese
Exclusion Criteria:
- failed to provide consent

facility.name: The Chinese University of Hong Kong

clinical_study.keyword: men who have sex with men
